string.text: Regular outfit

A regular coat that's made out of of thick cloth that has a hood, a pair of jeans, and a pair of high boots. This set of clothes presumably came from outside the of the border of the Zone. It'll give you some protection against scratches or wounds, but it won't protect you against the Zone's anomalies. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 0-0-0%c[default]
Outfit with exoskeleton
A regular coat that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 0-0-0%c[default]
Outfit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A regular coat that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-0%c[default]
Anomalous coat

This coat was stripped off a stalker who died in a "Fruit punch" anomaly. Having laid a long time in the anomaly, the coat obtained the ability to speed up metabolism. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 0-0-0%c[default]
Anomalous coat with exoskeleton
A anomalous coat that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 0-0-0%c[default]
Anomalous coat with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A anomalous coat that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-0%c[default]
Stalker suit

Being produced by local craftsmen, stalker suits tend to be a wild combination of many types of common clothes and equipment. They usually consist of light armor and an outfit that's made out of rubberized cloth or tarpaulin. Most craftsmen put knee and elbowpads on the suits to protect the user's more senisitive joints against the environment. These suits give good against protection against bullet rounds or weaker mutants, but they're useless for raids deep inside the Zone - far dangerous mutants and anomalies exist there. On the flip side, this suit is inexpensive and can be repaired easily. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-1%c[default]
Stalker suit with exoskeleton
A stalker suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-1%c[default]
Stalker suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A stalker suit that's equipped with an KNIGHT external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-1%c[default]
Ghost's suit

Rumor has it that Ghost never carried a first aid kit with him. Everything heals on him like on a dog. They say that he has an unusual suit that he got on an anomaly. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-1%c[default]
Ghost's suit with exoskeleton
Ghost's suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-1%c[default]
Ghost's suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
Ghost's suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-1%c[default]
Tourist suit

The former owner of this suit was a real tourist and, it seems, often went on very difficult, on the verge of human endurance, hiking trips. He knew how to distribute correctly the weight that he carried, and which things to give preference to. The coat pockets and the educated choice of the backpack allow its owner to carry a heavy weight. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-1%c[default]
Tourist suit with exoskeleton
A 'tourist' suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-1%c[default]
Tourist suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A 'tourist' suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-1%c[default]
SERAFIM suit

This suit was produced by one of Kiev's defence research institutes and represents an excellent alternative to the hand-made stalker suits. It's an excellent combination of an bulletproof vest, a closed cycle breathing system and an integrated system of anomalous field suppression. Due to the perfect choice of the materials, it's a good choice. The only disadvantage is its high price. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 3-2-2%c[default]
Bandit jacket

Traditional bandit clothing - a leather jacket with armor pieces sewed in. The protection it provides is completely inadequate for the harsh conditions of the Zone. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-0%c[default]
Bandit jacket with exoskeleton
A bandit jacket that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-0%c[default]
Bandit jacket with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A bandit jacket that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-0%c[default]
Bandit commander's jacket

The typical garment a bandit commander wears in the Zone consists of a highly modified stalker outfit with a trenchcoat. Stalkers who were part of the Sin faction first wore these, then Strelok's group copied the design from them. Now it's used by bandit commanders for protection. These cost a fortune to buy! But still, they look cool. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-1-1%c[default]
Bandit veteran suit

These suits are worn by veteran bandits. They're produced by skilled bandit craftsman under the guidance of Fraer, a professional arms seller with deep ties to the criminal underworld in Ukraine. Only Borov's most trusted commissars wear it. These suits consist of a modified stalker suit, and a trenchcoat that's made out of hardened leather with lining. This suit also has steel plates placed in key spots, which provides good protection from bullets. However, this suit offers little to no protection from the Zone's anomalies - although this makes sense in context because bandits never really go out of their way to wander through anomalies for artifacts. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 3-1-1%c[default]
PSZ-9d Duty suit

Produced by one of Kiev's defence research institutes and commissioned by the Duty faction. It is as simple and reliable as the standard PSZ-9 model, but due to the new materials, it provides good protection from various harmful impacts, including firearm damage. The vest still needs some work because it has no breathing protection system. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 3-1-1%c[default]
PSZ-9d Duty suit with exoskeleton
A PSZ-9d suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 3-1-1%c[default]
PSZ-9d Duty suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A PSZ-9d suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-1%c[default]
Modified PSZ-9d Duty suit
A modified version of the PSZ-9d suit that gives better protection against mutants. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 3-1-2%c[default]
Modified PSZ-9d Duty suit with exoskeleton
A modified PSZ-9d suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 3-1-2%c[default]
Modified PSZ-9d Duty suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A modified PSZ-9d suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-2%c[default]
Guardian of Freedom suit

This stalker bodysuit with reinforced body armor made by Freedom craftsmen represents a good compromise between combat and anomaly protection. The built-in body armor comprises armor plating and ten Kevlar layers, capable of stopping a pistol bullet. The suit uses the relatively expensive Sovereign compound for anomaly protection. Comes with an artifact container. %c[100,50,250,80] 
 
Bulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 4-2-3%c[default] %c[100,255,0,0] 
 
Due to the bulky design of this suit, it's impossible to mount a 2nd generation KNIGHT exoskeleton on top of it.
Guardian of Freedom suit with exoskeleton
A Guardian of Freedom suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 4-2-3%c[default]
Guardian of Freedom suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A Guardian of Freedom suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-3%c[default]
Mercenary suit

Stalker suit from the Merc faction. Its design is based on the suit used by the special forces of Western armies. Due to a special treatment of the fabric, the armor has a strengthened stability during the physical movement of its plates. Its protective properties are slightly better then those of the PSZ-7 military bulletproof suits. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 3-1-1%c[default]
Mercenary suit with exoskeleton
A mercenary suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 3-1-1%c[default]
Mercenary suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A mercenary suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-1%c[default]
Reinforced mercenary suit

There is chain mail sewn into the lining of this suit, which increases the level of protection this suit gives against bullets and mutant attacks. A PNV is also included with this suit. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 3-1-2%c[default]
Reinforced mercenary suit with exoskeleton
A reinforced mercenary suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 3-1-2%c[default]
Reinforced mercenary suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A reinforced mercenary suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-2%c[default]
SSP-99 Ecologist

A SSP-99 chemical protection suit specially designed for the Zone's conditions. It's used by scientific expeditions and the eco-stalkers who cooperate with them. It has an integrated air-filtering and air-conditioning system. It is resistant against heat and electricity, and it also provides good protection from radiation and biological anomalies. It's also resistant to chemically aggressive environments. It is not designed for combat, so it doesn't provide protection against bullets or grenade fragments. %c[100,50,250,80] 
 
Bulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 1-1-1%c[default] %c[100,255,0,0] 
 
The suit's life support system does not allow an exoskeleton to be mounted on top.
SSP-99M Suit

High quality modified SSP-99 suit. This variant of the SSP-99 suit was modified to provide better protection against bullets and grenade fragments. It is designed for the guards working with scientific expeditions. It provides good protection from radiation and biological anomalies. It is resistant to chemically aggressive environments and other effects dangerous to the body. %c[100,50,250,80] 
 
Bulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-1-1%c[default] %c[100,255,0,0] 
 
The suit's life support system does not allow an exoskeleton to be mounted on top.
PSZ-7 suit

A standard set of military fatigues with a bulletproof vest; the specific bulletproof vest intergrated with a gear rig that's currently used by the Ukrainian Army is known as the 'PSZ-7' (Personal Protection System). It gives protection against bullets and grenade fragments, but it won't protect you against anomalies at all. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-0%c[default]
PSZ-7 suit with exoskeleton
A PSZ-7 suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-0%c[default]
PSZ-7 suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A PSZ-7 suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-0%c[default]
Beryl-5M suit

The Beryl-5M suit is a PS5-series suit that's been combined with beryllium sputter, making it ideal for use in the Zone. This suit is designed for assault operations in highly radioactive areas, although it is ineffective in areas of high anomalous activity. The suit makes its way to stalkers through the military, who exchange it for loot. Does not come with an artifact container. %c[100,50,250,80] 
 
Bulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 4-3-1%c[default] %c[100,255,0,0] 
 
Due to the bulky design of this suit, it's impossible to mount a 2nd generation KNIGHT exoskeleton on top of it.
Beryl-5M suit with exoskeleton
A Beryl-5M suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 4-3-1%c[default]
Beryl-5M suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A Beryl-5M suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-1%c[default]
Healing Beryl-5M suit

The fabric of the suit is saturated with a streptozoidal lotion, which speeds up the healing of wounds. %c[100,50,250,80] 
 
Bulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 4-3-1%c[default] %c[100,255,0,0] 
 
Due to the bulky design of this suit, it's impossible to mount a 2nd generation KNIGHT exoskeleton on top of it.
Healing Beryl-5M suit with exoskeleton
A healing Beryl-5M suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 4-3-1%c[default]
Healing Beryl-5M suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A healing Beryl-5M suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-1%c[default]
SKAT-9M suit

This SKAT-9M bulletproof military suit is designed for assault operations in areas of anomalous activity. It includes a PSZ-12p heavy military bulletproof suit, an integrated compensation suit and a Sphere-12M helmet. It provides perfect protection from bullets and splinters and it doesn't decrease the soldier's mobility. It has a balanced system of anomaly protection. %c[100,50,250,80] 
 
Bulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 4-3-2%c[default] %c[100,255,0,0] 
 
Due to the bulky design of this suit, it's impossible to mount a 2nd generation KNIGHT exoskeleton on top of it.
SKAT-9 suit with exoskeleton
A SKAT-9 suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 4-3-2%c[default]
SKAT-9 suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A SKAT-9 suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-2%c[default]
Monolith suit

Stalker suit from the Monolith faction. The producer is unknown. Its protective properties are slightly worse then those of the PSZ-9a military bulletproof vest. Its structure is similar to the suit popular with neutral stalkers which combines a bulletproof vest and a radiation protection suit. It provides good protection from gunfire. Its level of anomaly protection is low due to the absence of an air filtering system. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-1%c[default]
Monolith suit with exoskeleton
A Monolith suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-1%c[default]
Monolith suit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A Monolith suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-1%c[default]
Strange Monolith suit

This Monolith suit is unusual. There's a strange attachment near the lumbar support and in helmet. It looks like a common feature found in many Monolith suits, but upon closer inspection it looks to be nearly out of place for a common Monolith suit. This attachment has a powerful current collector, which is well grounded, and it seems to provide good protection against psy-related damage. Obvoiusly, this is a suit that's meant to be used in places with high psychotronic emissions or for experiments with psy-mutants. It also looks like this outfit was a prototype for the more common Monolith suit. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-1%c[default]
Strange Monolith outfit with exoskeleton
A strange Monolith suit that's equipped with an external exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 2-0-1%c[default]
Strange Monolith outfit with KNIGHT exoskeleton
A strange Monolith suit that's equipped with an external KNIGHT exoskeleton. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-1%c[default]
Monolith exoskeleton

This suit is actually an exoskeleton attached to a protective suit. Its origin is unknown. The exoskeleton itself is made out of a strange material that has properties unknown to science. The exoskeleton itself doesn't augment the user's strength that much, but it's very lightweight and mobile. The suit that's attached to the exoskeleton gives good protection from bullets, radiation, mutants, and anomalies. There's also a strange-looking attachment on the suit itself that's near the suit's lumbar support area. %c[100,50,250,80] \n \nBulletproof rating (body-head-neck): 5-4-1%c[default]
Exoskeleton

An experimental sample of a military exoskeleton. It was never mass-produced due to its very high cost and design flaws. Despite this, it is in demand due to its ability to take on the weight of all carried equipment, and therefore small batches are made in underground facilities outside Ukraine. Comes with a built-in artifact container.
KNIGHT exoskeleton

The KNIGHT exoskeleton has been designed to be used in combat, augmenting the mobility and stamina of any soldier that wears it. They are produced by a classified Russian defense contractor, and can be bought via special order. It's mostly made out of lightweight composites, so it's considerably lighter and more mobile than older exoskeletons. It's powered by an advanced power source that's small, efficient, and compact, and it also relies on a artifical muscle-related technology to help augment the user's strength, although it can't carry as much as older exoskeletons - those were purely designed to help augment the user's strength and mobility without much regard for being viable for use in combat. As mentioned, this was designed to be used in combat, so some sacrifices had to made during its design. This exoskeleton can be equipped over any outfit that allows it to mount to the user's back, hands, and legs.
Remove exoskeleton
Exoskeleton provides excelent protection of wounds and fragments, but slows his host. Can be damaged with armor piercing ammo.
Exoskeleton
Military outfit was designed for combat operations. Provides excellent protection of wounds and fragments, has good mobility. Can be damaged with armor piercing ammo.
Military outfit

This outfit was designed for scientific activity in the Zone. Has closed air purification system and built-in system of the inhibition of anomaly impacts, so it's best against anomalies. Very fragile due to low protection. Has built-in container for artifacts.
Scientific outfit
